place.name: EASTON
place.gazetteerText: EASTON, a parish in Forehoe district, Norfolk; on an affluent of the river Wensum, near Costessey Park, 5 miles NE by N of Kimberley r. station and 6½ WNW of Norwich. It has a post office under Norwich. Acres, 1, 576. Real property, £2, 485. Pop., 233. Houses, 54. Easton Lodge is a chief residence. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Norwich. Value, not reported. Patron, E. R. Fellows, Esq. The church is ancient. There are chapels for Baptists and Wesleyans. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
